alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Big Horn and eastern Carbon Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Smith, or 35 miles southwest of Hardin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Smith, St. Xavier and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn
